message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.SD, cs.CL

The paper discusses the impact of social media on the way users process information and engage in public debate, which falls under the category of social media and society (cs.SI). The paper also addresses the cognitive weaknesses induced by this new information environment, which could be categorized under cybersecurity (cs.CR) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The paper also discusses the phenomenon of (mis)information operations, which could be categorized under cybercrime (cs.CR) and security and privacy (cs.SD). Finally, the paper proposes an integrated research roadmap, which could be categorized under natural language processing (cs.CL) and machine learning (cs.LG).
